quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I gotcha one. [Pam hands over a grape soda to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh wow, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm just gonna grab some chips, you want some?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No. Thanks... uh we're still having lunch today, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I guess. [Pam smiles and walks away, then comes back and kisses Jim on the cheek] How dare you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Toby. What's this? [holds up memo Toby has passed out to the staff]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [reads memo] I just want to remind everyone about the company rules involving PDA or public displays of affection.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yes, uh some people in the office have complained...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh really.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...about some other people engaging in PDA and, you know [Michael leans in closer to Toby] I just wanted to remind it's not appropriate to, to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is this about me and Jan? In my office? Because I will have you know that that was consensual. What we did has nothing to do with you or anyone here. I don't think. I don't think anyone heard anything. We were very discreet and, and most people had left by that point. So I don't think it's any of your business. What I think you should do is roll up the memo, real tight...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Ok, look the memo is not about you...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [to everyone in the room] For the record, I have never been involved with anyone at work, in any capacity.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Alright everyone, look, it, alright my complaint was about Jim and Pam. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [turns to address Jim and Pam] No way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You guys are together?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ummm... yup. Yes, we are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Woooah! Wow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I knew it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You guys! Yes! Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Toby, was this your fun little way of congratulating us?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh kay, mind is exploding. Get over here. [gestures to Pam to get up] Come on. Come here. Okay, okay, [to Jim] stand up. [Jim moves over in chair] OK, here we go. [holding both Pam and Jim's hand] Everyone, this is a day that will live in infamy. Because today, is the day that Jim and Pam become one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Actually, we've been dating for a couple months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love you guys, so much. [hugs Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ohh.. [Michael goes to hug Pam, phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Phone's ringing. [goes back toward desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no Pam let 'em ring. Let the bells of Dunder Mifflin chime out your love. Because this is [starts to well up] really good, this is really good. My heart soars with the eagles nest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't see it. I think they both could do better.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's not a surprise to me. Pam is the office mattress.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jim Halpert's off the market. Guess who just became the best looking single guy in the office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey. Can you make that straighter? That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Did you plan it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. [tries to hide piece of paper, but Pam grabs it]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [reading from paper] Can you make that straighter? That job looks hard. You should put your mouth on that. How can you even use that one naturally?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Blowing up balloons I thought.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You might want to trim it a little.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael... [Kelly enters conference room in a flirty red dress]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [reading sign] Oh, is... Ryan coming back today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, he is.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam and Jim are together. Ryan is visiting. Only thing that could make this day better is ice cream.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: To give you this [reveals a cat from under a coat].

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, what is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's a feral barn cat. I trapped him last night and I'm giving him to you as a replacement cat for the one I destroyed.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Her name was Sprinkles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And his name is... Garbage. Mose calls him Garbage because he likes to eat garbage. [shakes cat] Don't you Garbage? [makes chomping noises]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I can't believe you just thought you could replace Sprinkles. Before she's even in the ground.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You haven't buried her yet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Don't rush me. I'm grieving.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Garbage can be very helpful. OK, he's a youthful cat. He killed an entire family of raccoons. [holds cat towards Angela] Look at him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't want Garbage! I want Sprinkles! [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey... [sees both Jim and Pam] you two.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey. So now that we are dating, uh, we just wanted to know if we had to sign one of those 'we're dating' things for the company.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh well, you know, those were only for, you know [makes quotes with fingers] relationships, so... if, if this is just a casual thing, there's no need, really.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, I don't wanna speak for Jim, but, it's like pretty official. [Jim smiles]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry, uh do we need to sign one, or...?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Let's just wait and see what happens. [whispers] You know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Let's just wait.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Great. [Jim and Pam walk away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [sees Ryan coming through door] Hey Ryan. Welcome back --

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hold on one second. [Ryan types on Blackberry for a few seconds] Hey Pam! It's great to see you. Is Michael in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There he is! There he is! He's back! And he's with a beard. [laughing] He... He has facial hair. Look at him! All grown up and no place to go. Hello, Mr. Sunny Crockett. I'm Tubs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: OK. Should we get started?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ohh, yeah, let's get started because uh, yes, cause uh this is very serious business and umm..

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yep, exactly. This is a business meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...business meeting --

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [rubbing hands in Ryan's hair] Fire!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Stop that! Stop that!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's right! That's right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [to Kevin] You scared me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fire guy. Don't start any fires, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Fire guy [makes flames with his hands]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You weren't here for that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Here for what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: When he started the fire.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look how big he is. Look at you, you are so mature and old and little man now. You're like our little man...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Little old man boy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael and everybody, umm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Beard.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Bearded man boy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: ...let me just say something. I know I used to be a temp here, but now everything is different. I'd like your respect. I am your boss now. You're gonna have to treat me that same way you treated Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, wow!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's a little kinky. I don't swing that way.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: OK...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Woooo![laughs] I think Ryan has a gay crush on me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Enough! OK? This is inappropriate  and it stops right now. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, everybody, come on. Settle town. Let's get serious here. Um Ryan, has a very special, important presentation to do, which we will be doing in the conference room in [looks at Ryan] 10 minutes?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sounds good. OK, alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, Ryan snapped at me, but there was this twinkle in his eye that I picked up on, which said, "Dude, we're friends. I'm doing this for appearances. I am the big boss now. And I have to seem like an ogre. But you know me and you trust me. And we like each other. And we'll always be friends. And I would never take you for granted in a million years. And I miss you, man. And I love you." His words.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin Infinity represents a floor to ceiling streamlining of our business model. The center piece of the campaign is a new business-to-business website interface that will allow us to compete directly with big box chains.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait a second. Last time I checked, Dunder Mifflin already has a website. And quite frankly, I'm not really sure what's wrong with it. [Jim at his desk, showing the Dunder Mifflin website reading "Under Construction. Coming Christmas 2002!"]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: This is a massive overhaul. We're getting younger. Sleeker. And more agile so that we adapt to the market place. All essential personnel will be issued Blackberries for company use.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OOhh. Gimmme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'll stick around to help you set them up afterwards. Any questions? Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What if we don't want to use a Blackberry because they are stupid and pointless?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: This is company-wide, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Got it. [Andy's hand goes up]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We should call it Dunder Mifflinfinity. You know, push the words together?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Any other questions? [Kelly's hand goes up] Kelly Kapoor.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Can we speak privately about our relationship?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thank you everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ryan Howard everybody. [starts clapping] Good job. [everyone gets up to leave]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: That's some fun stuff. When does the website go up?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: As fast as possible. We want to start retraining people A.S.A.P., so we can hit the ground running with a new system.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Cool beans.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: We're screwed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who is?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Us? You and me. The old timers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am not old. You are old. You are like a hundred.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: You're over 40, that's the cut off. Are you listening to what he's saying? Re-training. New system. Youth. I'm telling you this kid is the grim reaper. You deal with this or you, me, Sammy, Phyllis, the chick you hit with the car, we're goners.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Swore I wouldn't tell anyone this, but in the interest of revealing secrets. Oh my God, this will make your brain explode. Umm, Dwight and Angela dating. Have been for six months.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.. [in awe]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Swear to God. [Pam shakes her head]. Aww this is great. I was actually gonna wait and tell you on your birthday, but this is much more fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, they have been dating for like two years. [Jim in shock] Since before your barbeque.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait. What? [Pam nods her head] You knew? And you didn't say anything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You didn't say anything to me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Fair enough. Wow! We should have started dating like a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Can you believe that...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Sorry, I didn't know you guys were in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no, we're just sitting here.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I couldn't see your hands. [Jim shakes his hands] Hey Pam, by the way, it's great that you're dating. But when a new client calls, you just have to randomly assign them to a sales person. You can't base who gets new clients on who you're sleeping with that week, OK?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And... that is why we waited so long to tell people.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: OK, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, kay. I was just... After the presentation, just wanted to make sure, that vis-a-vie, that everything in the office is business as usual?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Well it is business, but not as usual.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, I know I understand... we're making great strides and we're updating, but business as usual, no?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No. [shaking head] We're throwing out the entire playbook, we're starting from scratch, we're implementing a brand new system.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good, so, we're on the same page?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No. We're not. Michael, I know exactly how much time and man power are wasted in this branch. This company is getting younger, faster, more efficient. You need to prepare yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We had a foreign exchange student live with us when I was young. And we called him my brother. And that's who I thought he was. Um, then he went home to what is now formerly Yugoslavia, taking all of my blue jeans with him. And I had to spend the entire winter in shorts. That is what Ryan is like. A fake brother who steals your jeans.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: So, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Awesome. I am dating a lot of guys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: A lot. Black guys mostly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Wait, uh, how do you touch just one of these buttons at a time?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Did you even try?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: If the kid wants to set mine up, I'll let him.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I can't see half of the things. [adjusts glasses]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's too little. Use the phone.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I want you to tell me that you care about me. That is what I want.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly, I'm your boss now, OK? You can't keep talking to me like I'm your boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh big strong man, fancy new whatever. I don't think you ever cared about me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I never cared about you? Six months ago Karen Filipelli sent me an email. Asked me out. I said no, because I was committed to our relationship.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, I hope you're still committed because I'm pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [shaking head]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And guess what buddy, [points at Ryan] I am keeping it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: OK. OK.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Do you feel prepared to help me raise a baby?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I can... I can't talk about this right now, OK? After work, we'll go out to dinner, we'll talk about it then, OK?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: We have a date!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hello, Dwight. I've been thinking about things and I wanted to know if you would have dinner with me tonight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll make a reservation. No, no. Let me cook for you. Cauliflower and noodles. Baked potato on the side.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I would prefer a public place. See you after work.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hi, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Is Michael in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: In his office. You can go right in.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [to Ryan] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Ryan. Ryan. Ryan, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: So elephant in the room, I have your old job.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Well, not exactly my job... I had a different title.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Oh well, excuse me, same office, same responsibilities.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Different salary. [laughs] You'll get there, don't worry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Well... you look great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Thank you, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Scranton suits you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Best decision I ever made.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You were let go.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You know what? I love the beard. Keep it forever. [goes into Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [holds up Blackberry] Hey, what is the actual deal with these things in terms of testicles?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't want to grow weird sperm in case we ever want to have kids.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: So, what's Ryan doing here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, I dunno, they're launching a big new business plan. New website, blah blah blah. He's being a real twerp about it, so, it's all about youth, and agility and streamlining and trying to squeeze out the older people.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: He's such a snake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I hope he's gets hit with an ageism suit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is that... word?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Ageism? Companies they can't discriminate against people due to old age. Like a couple years ago we tried to force out some of the older branch managers with a mandatory retirement age and then Ed Truck, your old boss, threatened us with a lawsuit, so we had to back off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So older people have just as many rights as younger people?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yes, Michael, they do.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Everything OK? [Creed has made his hair jet black]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Everything's cool, dude.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I'm thirty. Well, in November I'll be thirty.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Is there another meeting scheduled, I was gonna do the Blackberry tutorial in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael told us to wait in here. We don't know why.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [notices pictures on the wall] Ohh... man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good, we're all here, we can get started.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: We're not doing this today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Have a seat. Like everybody else.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: OK. This is...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Still my office, Ryan. [Ryan sits down] Well, there has been a lot of talk about new ideas today. Well, new ideas are fine, but they are also... illegal, because they are a form of ageism. What? Yes, I am right. Did you know that the Age Discrimination and Employment Act of 1967 prohibits employment discrimination based on age with respect to employees 40 years of age or older? I did.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Technically, he's right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, shut up Toby. Look, why do we as a society hate old people so much?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Because they're lame.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Creed, no they are not. In fact, many cultures revere old people because of their storytelling ability. Like the old lady from Titanic. [points to her picture on the wall] Or the funny things that they can do, like "where's the Beef?" [points to another picture on wall] [Jim raises his hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why do you have the Big picture up again? You used that already, when you burned your foot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Reusing the Ben Kingsley, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was going to put up some new pictures, but umm, all of the ink in the printer was gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh. [man enters conference room]

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [puts hand up] That is me. Come on in. [They shake hands] Who is this old fart? Did you just stagger off the street? Out of a box or something? Who's this worthless bag of bones? Well, this guy is none other than one of the founders of Dunder Mifflin, Mr. Robert Dunder. Huh? [starts clapping, others join in]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Thank you everyone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael, [gets up] can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure thing. [both go out of conference room] 'Scuse me. [closes door]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: We have actual work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fine. Then I will call David Wallace and you can explain to him why you threw the founder of the company out on his ancient butt. [they glare at each other]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Bob, how old are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Eighty-seven years young. And still active. That is great. Did you know, that Bob is still a member of the Board of Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Well, I, I, I haven't been to a board meeting in years. I, I send a proxy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, still sends his own proxy. Good for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm gonna live for a very long time. My grandma Schrute lived to be 101. My grandpa Manheim is 103, and still puttering around in Argentina. I tried to go visit him once, but my travel visa was protested by the Shoah Foundation.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: I started this company in 1949.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Back then, it was an uh, an industrial supplier of metal brackets mostly for, for construction.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, boy.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: And then Mifflin, of course he killed himself later... Uh, but I knew Mifflin through the Rotary Club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: And he was, he was [starts laughing] at dinner with Beverly and her husband, wha-what was his name, umm... uhh... Jerry.. Jerry Trupiano from, from South Jersey and he was tall. Both he and Mifflin were tall guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: And...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's great. Thank you for coming in. [starts ushering him out] Robert Dunder everybody. [clapping] Thank you. That was wonderful. Do you have a ride?

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Well I, I, I came here in a cab.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Perfect. [starts closing the door]

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.line: Well, cou, could you get me another... [Michael closes door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Inspirational. What have we learned?  Well, we have learned that you can't teach an old dog new tricks, because it's illegal, and you will go to jail. [Pam raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think that I should help him get home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, No. Don't help him. He doesn't need help, Pam. [Jim nods head and Pam gets up and leaves to help Robert Dunder, Michael shows Robert thumbs up] What a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good night guys. [staff leaves the office]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Well, today was a fantastic waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I disagree, I think it was very valuable.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael, technology helps business OK? You should not resist it, this is the way the world is moving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I happen to think the old ways of doing business are better. And I can prove it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ok. I look forward to hearing your ideas. [Michael retreats back to office] [to Kelly] Where do you wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You know, some place romantic and expensive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly, come on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You know what, you're right. I'm feeling kind of nauseous anyway. So, you know skip it. [Ryan hesitates and takes her hand and they exit]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you enjoying your vegetarian noodles?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Very much. How's your meat?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dry. Delicious.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I heard a joke today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, that's funny.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes, it was.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you enjoying your mineral water?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I can't do this. I can't be with you. Every time I look in your eyes I see Sprinkles' stiff lifeless body.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Then don't look in my eyes. Look right here [points to middle of forehead above the eyes], it's an old sales trick.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm sorry. I gave this everything I could.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, please don't do this, monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I will leave your toothbrush on top of your tire tomorrow morning. [gets up and leaves restaurant]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey guys.  This is my, uh, girlfriend, Amy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Amy.  How ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [under his breath] Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [gesturing to the rest of the office] This is everybody else... okay... This is the place... so thanks for the lift.

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.line: Yeah, sure. I'll, uh, I'll see you tonight, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Absolutely. [Toby kisses Amy for an extended period of time, Pam and Jim are shocked]

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.line: Whoa.  Easy tiger.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I just really like you.

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.line: Okay.  Bye guys.  Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Have a great day!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Whoa, Toby.  Watch out.  You're going to violate your own PDA memo.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I wouldn't want to do that now would I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Smell that. Do you smell that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dry rot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Dwight. That smells like good business to me. What I have done here is I have collected all the finest gourmet items that Scranton has to offer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Mmhmm, sweet, chocolate turtles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, no! No, those are for our clients. Actually, our exclients. I'll explain, later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ryan wants everything in our company to be about emails and IM's, but I think he's forgetting about the original instant message. Letters attatched to baskets of food.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Excuse me, Angela. Michael asked me to turn in these reciepts for these gift basket items.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is that all?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes... [whispers] I miss you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Elevators.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, you have to listen to me! We are not seeing each other anymore! Can you accept that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Fine. [sighs] Then I just want to be friends.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Plus a little extra. Also, I love you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't understand what the big deal is.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You don't?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You lied about being pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Right, so?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You really don't understand why that might make me kind of angry?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: We're never getting back together.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright I just have to ask now that we're public, um, is the magic gone?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's funny you bring that up because yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I knew it. Oh man, just like that huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think... I mean, I don't know what it is but...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Be honest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I now find you repulsive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's honest. [sighs] Alright, fair enough. It was really fun while it lasted though, wasn't it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Eh...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: For me, it was.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey boss, I didn't know you were coming in today.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What's, uh, going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am glad that you asked, listen up everybody. In the last year, we have lost seven clients to the big chains. These gift baskets are our ticket back into their lives. We are going to show up at these businesses unannounced, and we are going to win them back.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: With gift baskets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: With peanut brittle, with macadamia nut cookies, with chocolate turtles, with raspberry jam and a little bit of fat and salt because you know what? That's what people like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ever since I was a kid people have been telling me I can't do things. "You can't be on the team", "You can't move on to second grade". Well, now they're telling me that I can't win back clients using old fashioned business methods. [shakes head] We'll see about that. And FYI, I eventually aced second grade, and I was the biggest kid in class.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. We're gonna split up into teams. Jim, Phyllis. Stanley, Dwight. Me Andy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm not driving with him. [points at Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'll go with you Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Or him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why don't we just go by ourselves?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't we just go as teams to demonstrate our teamsmanship?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: This is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, that's not helpful Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: How is giving people gift baskets going to get our clients back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Gift baskets are amazing, Phyllis. Gift baskets are... the essence of class and fanciness. They are the ultimate present that a person can recieve.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What about cash? With cash you can buy anything you want, including a gift basket, so... it's kind of the best gift ever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What about a gift basket full of cash?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes! Cash basket! Nice work Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fine, I'm just going to go by myself, and I am going to win them back by myself because this is important to me. [walks toward the door]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael, wait. Let me go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, this is my quest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please, let me go. I need to win those clients back. [camera moves around and zooms in at Angela's face] Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fine. Then God speed. To both of us.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Good luck Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We don't need luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But thank you, that was really nice of you to say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Business to business. The old fasioned way. No Blackberrys, no websites. I would like to see a website deliver baskets of food to people.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [speaking on the phone] Yes, I understand that David. I just felt that if we were to downsize Kelly and then outsource customer service to India which a lot of companies... Yeah, no, yes Kelly is Indian... I understand that's confusing.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [looks at vending machine] Hey brah, I've been meaning to ask you, can we get some Red Bull for these things? Sometimes a guy's gotta ride the bull, am I right? Later skater.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [in Michael's car] Sweet ride, American made. What happened to the Sebring?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is in the body shop. Had to have the dent taken out of the hood where I hit Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah, that's a pain in the ass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know. So who's next?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Larry Myers. Left us six months ago for Office Depot.

quotes.speaker: GPS
quotes.line: Proceed to the highlighted route, then route guidence will begin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why do you use that thing? Let's them know where you are at all times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The government, spy satellites, private detectives... exgirlfriends. [sobs and then starts to cry]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Next night, I'm out, at a bar, 2 AM, I figure I'll get a sandwich because you can get a sandwich any time of the night. [claps hands] I run into Vince Vaughn.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No way!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Literally.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dude, you are so money, but you don't even know it, but you do.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: ... Later guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, later dude.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Later man.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, Jim! How awesome is Ryan now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, he's definitely something.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That whole lifestyle, his whole vibe, you find that appealing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ha! Tuna... [inhales deeply] Tuna Tuna Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Tuna Tuna Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: He has a killer job, he's rich, he smells like what I think Pierce Brosnan probably smells like, he wears really cool rich guy clothes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: And he can get any girl that he wants.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So, sorry Tuna but if you don't know why that's awesome... then... you need awesome lessons.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Tuna. Check you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [places the gift basket on top of the table] Wow, those things are heavy! There's a lot of stuff in there. We have macadamia nut cookies, um, the honey mustard pretzels. Have you ever tried focaccia crisps?

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: You know we closed our account with you right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes we do.

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: We're with Office Depot now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, yes we know but we just have not gotten over you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And we are dedicated to providing you with the very best customer service, the very best personal business relationship we can if you ever decide to come back to us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: OK. I don't think we're coming back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please, come back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, you know what? Just enjoy the gift basket and remember that we provide a personal touch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Remember what we had Larry?

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: I mean, really it's about money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well just, uh enjoy the gift basket.

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: OK thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Larry Myers
quotes.line: I mean their website is really easy to use too. That's a big deal for us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [driving] That guy was so... how can they not know how much better we are?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't know. Sometimes people are just impossible and they make you miserable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is true.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Like Angela in accounting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, she is nuts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ugh... no, she's wonderful... at accounting. But she drives me crazy.

quotes.speaker: GPS
quotes.line: Make the next right turn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How do they know? How does this know where to turn? That's very impressive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey Pam. I haven't settled on our final design logo yet for Dunder Mifflin Infinity and I know you're into graphic design. Do you want to give it a shot? Maybe try and deisgn the logo?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh totally.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Cool, that would be great. Um, can you do a couple mock ups and I'll take a look?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I'm gonna do some mock ups, and then turn those into thumbnails, maybe do some... splash frames. [laughs] I don't know what I'm talking about but I'm excited.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And the last guy says "No, hairy body".

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: You know I have heard it before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, well it's still very good. I bet I know someone who hasn't heard that joke... your daughter Emily. How's she doing?

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: She's great, thanks for asking. Great memory.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She's gonna be like eleven this winter? Wow, they grow up so fast. I have a few of my own that I want some day. Listen, I don't want to take any more of your time, I know you're a very busy man. The reason we have stopped by is to drop you off this elaborate bag of goodies, and to ask you to reconsider.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, OK! So you'll reconsider?

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: OK thanks for the goodies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah... .is that all you have to say?

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: It looks delicious? I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You don't know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look, we want you back.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Can you offer lower prices?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, no.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Then we're not coming back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He's not coming back, it's over Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No it's not.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: No he's right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Accept it, why would he come back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why would he come back? I will tell you, Dwight. He would come back because we offer a wide selection of products and because you're definitely not getting the same sort of customer service that you get with us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's not gonna change his mind. He's moving on. We had our chance and we killed it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look... we're also coming out with a website soon. It's a state of the art thing, it'll be up and running, it's gonna cut costs and it will make ordering much much easier.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Oh, OK. Well when it's up, I'll check it out, and if it really cuts costs maybe we'll come back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Great, the magic of the gift basket.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: That I don't care about as much. Let me know when the site's up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, good. Don't let Emily have any of the cajun almonds, she's alergic.

quotes.speaker: GPS
quotes.line: Proceed straight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [in Michael's car] Well we're O for six. Last chance is the Elmhurst country club. Other side of the lake, on the southeast side.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't get it, I really don't get it. I thought this would work. I do everything I had at that guy and nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's how it goes sometimes, you know? You lose everything and everything falls apart and eventually you die and no one remembers you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is a very good point, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: GPS
quotes.line: Make a right turn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait wait wait! No no no! It means bear right, up there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it said right, it said take a right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No no no, look, it means go up to the right, bare right, over the bridge and hook up with 307.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Maybe it's a shortcut Dwight. It said go to the right. [turns right]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It can't mean that! There's a lake there!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The machine knows where it is going!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is the lake!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The machine knows--- stop yelling at me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, it's--- there's no road here! [car drives into lake]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Remain calm! I have trained for this! [unfastens seat belt] Okay, exit the window! [Dwight and Michael exit through the window] Here we go! Look out for leeches! [swims toward Michael] Are you okay?! Swim for it! I got you! [Dwight grabs onto Michael while Michael opens the back door for the camera man] Michael! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let go, let go of me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I got you, I got you! [Michael and Dwight reach the ground]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [watching car get pulled from lake] You sure you're OK?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good, that is what's most important.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did you get the rental insurance? Because that is pretty important too at a time like this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What a disaster, this whole thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll call a cab. [brings out cell phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: These people just don't realize what a gift basket means, they don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Look at that, still works. Old fashioned cell phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What about that last guy, Aaron? Is he a jerk. "I don't even know if I want it. They're website is so easy". Yeah, well, you can have your technology jackass, look where it got us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [speaking on the cell phone] Yes, we need a cab at Lake Scranton, at the end of East Mountain Road, in the lake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hang up. [Dwight hangs up] You know what we're gonna do? We're walking back. We're walking back to that office and we're gonna reclaim our gift basket!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're gonna take what's rightfully ours! We're gonna take a stand, Dwight! We're gonna take a stand!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Take a stand!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So place it on the infinity thing without being obvious, you know? I'd love to do like a color version just to bring a little color to the logo.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I like it a lot. It's clear and subtle at the same time. It's really good, you have a real talent for this stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'd love to talk to you about it more.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That'd be great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Do you want to go out to dinner tonight?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh... is it...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Wear something nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I just... I just wanted to have dinner.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm uh, I'm dating Jim.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You're kidding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We're together.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: That's... great, I... that's awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [grabs paper with mockups] So let me um, let me look at these.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK great!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I guess he can't get any girl he wants.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Did you forget something? What happened to you guys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give it back. The gift basket, give it back.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Oh what is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's real simple. If you don't appreciate what we do, then give us back our basket.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Maybe you should leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, maybe we should, maybe we should leave. Come on, let's leave, but before we leave my wet friend and I are going to wait for our cabs on yours nice couches! [sits on couch]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can you call us a cab please, I'm gonna [gets water from his clothes on the couch] Oops, sorry!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look, my clothes are so wet!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nice leather, oh my shoes are so muddy! [rubs shoes on couch]

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: [comes back with gift basket] Alright here you go, take it back!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's been opened.

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Yeah it was mine!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's missing... the turtles. Where are the turtles? Where are the turtles?

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: Come on guys, get out of here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: WHERE ARE THE TURTLES? WHERE ARE THEY?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [enters nearby room] Excuse me I have an announcement to make. We seem to be missing a box of chocolate turtles with peacons, and we will not be leaving the premises until we obtain them. Hand. Over. The. Turtles. Now!

quotes.speaker: Ex-client
quotes.line: I ate them OK, I ate the turtles, they're gone!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [leaving] We'll bill you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: May I have your attention please? This office will not be using any new technology ever, starting now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: That is not correct.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ryan thinks that technology is the answer. Well guess what? I just drove my car into a lake.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You did what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I drove my car into a [bleep] lake. Why you may ask did I do this? Well, because of a machine. A machine told me to drive into a lake. And I did it! I did it because I trusted Ryan's precious technology, and look where it got me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Into a lake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Exactly!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Did you get any clients back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Maybe, maybe not, time will tell. But I will tell you one thing. Those gift baskets never endangered anybody's lives. [looks at Ryan] Game set match... point... Scott... game over... end of game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everyone always wants new things. Everybody likes new inventions, new technology. People will never be replaced by machines. In the end, life and business are about human connections. And computers are about trying to murder you in a lake. And to me the choice is easy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm not saying I had a meteoric rise... but I did.  And if they knew how much I was paying for my haircut now, they wouldn't be giving me a noogie.  ... It was two hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You should come visit.  The city is... amazing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know.  I love it there.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No.  You don't know until you live there.  There's something about waking up every morning and just being in that city.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmhmm, yeah, last time I was there I had a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No. You can't imagine it, though.  The energy when you're actually there.  You're just part of something bigger than you, that's moving faster than you.  Your dreams are... . it just... everything feels so limitless.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No.  It... eh... you can't... it's not about how it sounds.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeee... (grunts in frustration)

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.  My old friend Ryan Howard is coming back today for some big presentation.  Very, very excited.  He is my protege.  He is someone that I hand-raised, that I nurtured.  Um... he is like a prime cut of veal whom I nourished with my milk.  And now he is also my boss.  So, win/win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [pointing] Um... [camera reveals that "RYAN" is crossed out on the "Welcome Back RYAN banner"; "A**HOLE" is now written in. Kelly is sitting next to the banner]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, Okay.  Okay.  Just...[Michael takes down banner, clears throat]  Well, our old friend Ryan Howard is back, and we're going to give a little presentation about the future of our company.  So please listen up. [awkward pause] All right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [to Michael] Have a seat with everybody else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't want me to help?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You don't know what I'm going to talk about.  [Michael heads toward chairs]  Actually, can you do me a favor?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Can you get me a cold water?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I got it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: That's all right, Pam.  Michael's got it. [Michael and Ryan look at each other for 5 seconds]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] Um... yes, I'll be right back!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That was slightly harsh, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I spent three years, driving around, getting him yams and magic wands.  He can get me water.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think I know what's going on.  Ryan believes that there is some sort of special 'boss water' that he gets to drink now.  And there isn't.  But, um... don't tell him.  Don't tell him that.  I don't want to jeopardize our friendship.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ryan is causing some problems.  And you were always good at handling him.  What should I do to control him?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, he's super-ticklish, I don't know if that helps.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know, no, what... something else.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, he's also super-insecure about his height.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And he doesn't care about anybody but himself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And don't have sex with him, 'cause if you do, the next two years of your life will be a total waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: My generation's all about hard work and accomplishment.  Like... the moon landing.  Or Vietnam.  Rolling Stones.  Greatest band ever.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're forty-three.  Mick Jagger's like sixty-five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And still rockin', Oscar.  One of the greatest all-time oldies was a little Oriental guy named Confucius.  He literally invented the ancient Chinese secret.  Here's some of his quotes.  Confucius say, "Man who farts in church must sit in his own pew."  Confucius say, "Man with hand in pocket feel cocky all day."  Confucius also say, "Virgin like balloon.  One prick, all gone!"

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Did you Google Confucius and just print out the first thing you saw?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I skipped through all of the boring stuff and went right to his joke page.  Which proves that he was old, but he was also hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [sighs, whistles] Michael, please would you not email while we're having lunch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not.  It's solitaire.  See?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: BlackBerry.  Why would anyone name something like this after a fruit?  You wouldn't name an iPod after a fruit.  [drops BlackBerry on desk]  Excuse me while I type on my Banana.  I'm gonna go to the Orange store and buy an Apricot computer.  [thinks] Apple. [nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is going on the outside.  The pipe cleaner needs to go through the corner.  Do not tape those on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jan called and asked where you're going to meet for dinner.  She wants you to call her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm a little busy right now.  Could you BlackBerry me a message?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael doesn't know how to work his BlackBerry.  So when he says BlackBerry me a message, he means write it on a Post-it note and stick it to his BlackBerry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Okay, everyone, I have a conference call, but after that, I'm going to lead a BlackBerry tutorial for anyone who's having any problems.  Who here's set theirs up? [Jim and Andy raise their hands; Phyllis half-raises hers.  Ryan notices that Michael does not raise his]  Great.  Well, I will see the rest of you at 2:30.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You didn't set up your BlackBerry, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, I did, but I do not intend to use it.  It is pointless technology.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: As opposed to...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Printing press.  Tractor.  Mechanical thresher.  Telephone.  Airplane.  The only inventions that matter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What about cars?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They fall under the category of airplanes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: They do?  So, cars are flightless airplanes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Correct.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Got it.  They're like the penguins of the airplane family.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's an excellent analogy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight, what about vaccines?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [scoffs] Vaccines are for chumps!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My mom didn't believe in vaccines.  I got my smallpox the old-fashioned way.  And I survived.  So... joke's on you hospitals.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Creed is using the toaster as a mirror, and touching up his hair with a Sharpie and a comb] The one advantage to being older is that I know a few things about a few things, and I am young enough to not forget them.  And old enough to know the difference between the two.  I am old enough to take advantage of age discrimination laws, but young enough to date college girls.  But old enough to know better.  I'm at a perfect age.  I could die now.  But I won't, because I am young.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Sup? [rolls into kitchen on a skateboard]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hi, Creed, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Just boardin', you know how we do. [flips skateboard up]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I... like your hair.  I don't know if I told you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Oh, thanks ese.  So, what are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: To look younger, so the kid doesn't replace you with machines.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I think I'll just take my chances.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Suit yourself.  But, if it were me, Botox [points at Oscar], wig [points at Kevin].

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Wha...
